parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From psallo; a set piece of music, i.e. A sacred ode; collectively, the book of the Psalms.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Teaching, doctrine, what is taught. From didasko; instruction.
An unveiling, uncovering, revealing, revelation. From apokalupto; disclosure.
The tongue; by implication, a language.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Translation, interpretation, explanation. From the same as hermeneuo; translation.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Feminine of a compound of oikos and the base of doma; architecture, i.e. a structure; figuratively, confirmation.
